description: A delicious Filipino dish that combines the bitterness of ampalaya (bitter gourd) with the savory goodness of sardines in tomato sauce.
ingredients: [{"name": "Vegetable Oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "Garlic", "units": "cloves", "amount": 4}, {"name": "Onion", "units": "piece", "amount": 1}, {"name": "Tomato", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "Sardines in Tomato Sauce", "units": "can", "amount": 1}, {"name": "Ampalaya", "units": "kilograms", "amount": 0.25}, {"name": "Egg", "units": "pieces", "amount": 2}, {"name": "MAGGI® Magic Sarap®", "units": "sachet", "amount": 1}, {"name": "Water", "units": "cups", "amount": 0.5}]
instructions: 1. Sauté garlic, onion, tomato and sardines in oil. 2. Add ampalaya and sauté for 5mins. Stir in beaten egg and cook until barely set. 3. Season with 8g MAGGI® Magic Sarap® and pour water. Transfer on a serving plate and serve.
notes: Adding egg to ampalaya dishes balances the bitterness because of fat from yolk.
